Right, I think tf.assign(..., validate_shape=False) is unsafe wrt shape inference (which, for sanity's sake, assume that, once inferred, shape information is never invalidated).

If you want to use tf.assign(..., validate_shape=False) to change the shape of a variable later, you must construct the variable as x = tf.Variable(tf.ones([2, 3]), validate_shape=False).

body:
Right, I think `tf.assign(..., validate_shape=False)` is unsafe wrt shape inference (which, for sanity's sake, assume that, once inferred, shape information is never invalidated).

If you want to use `tf.assign(..., validate_shape=False)` to change the shape of a variable later, you must construct the variable as `x = tf.Variable(tf.ones([2, 3]), validate_shape=False)`.
